keyTakeAways: Amazon Web Services experienced a massive outage on Monday, impacting internet services reliant on its cloud platform.
The US has made moves restricting China’s access to semiconductor technology, reflecting broader geopolitical tensions over technology control.
A three-part series on climate change presents innovative solutions to address environmental challenges and promote sustainable futures.
Social media influencers misused search results to spread misinformation, highlighting vulnerabilities in digital information ecosystems.
A new transparency law in the US is praised by experts as a first step toward regulation, though it is considered 'light touch' and potentially insufficient.
A strategic move in advance of new trade talks with the US, signaling potential shifts in technology and economic policy.
Omar M. Yaghi, a chemist born to Palestinian refugee parents in Jordan, has been awarded a Nobel Prize, recognizing his contributions to chemistry and science education.
An electric carmaker launched a new model to combat slumping sales, reflecting industry efforts to adapt to market changes.
The deal gives the ChatGPT creator the option to buy up to 10 percent of AMD, indicating potential strategic investment in semiconductor technology.
Advances in AI-generated deepfake audio could lead to a significant increase in phone call fraud, raising security and ethical concerns.
The Nobel Prize in Medicine was announced on Monday, with five additional prizes to follow in the coming week, highlighting global scientific achievements.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The article covers a range of science and technology developments, including a massive Amazon Web Services outage that disrupted internet services, geopolitical tensions over semiconductor technology between the US and China, innovative climate change solutions, the misuse of social media to spread misinformation, a new US transparency law criticized for being insufficient, the Nobel Prize award to chemist Omar M. Yaghi, a new electric vehicle model to address declining sales, strategic investment between ChatGPT’s creator and AMD, rising risks from AI-generated deepfake audio, and the announcement of multiple Nobel Prizes highlighting global scientific achievements.
title: Science and Technology | Today's latest from Al Jazeera
